Detailed Description

Declare a generator by building one of these structs.

Field Documentation

int(* obdsim_generator::clearerrorcodes)(void *gen)

Called to signify that error codes should be cleared.

Returns:
-1 on error, 0 on success

Definition at line 75 of file datasource.h.

int(* obdsim_generator::create)(void **gen, const char *seed)

Initialise the data generator.

Returns:
0 for success, 1 for failure
Parameters:
genopaque data generator
seedintialisation seed. implementation specific

Definition at line 43 of file datasource.h.

void(* obdsim_generator::destroy)(void *gen)

Shut down the data generator.

Definition at line 46 of file datasource.h.

int(* obdsim_generator::geterrorcodes)(void *gen, unsigned int *errorcodes, int num_codes, int *mil)

Called to find out if there are any error conditions set, and what they are.

NOTE! errorcodes is an array of bytes. There are twice as many spaces in errorcodes as num_codes

Parameters:
errorcodespopulate this with the error codes currently set
num_codesnumber of errorcodes available to be populated
milwhether or not MIL is set
Returns:
-1 on error. >=0 num error codes. num_codes+1 to indicate "more than there was space for"

Definition at line 71 of file datasource.h.

int(* obdsim_generator::getvalue)(void *gen, unsigned int mode, unsigned int PID, unsigned int *A, unsigned int *B, unsigned int *C, unsigned int *D)

Get a value for the specified PID.

Returns:
number of values created, or -1 for "must exit"
Parameters:
modethe mode of the request
PIDthe PID this is for
genopaque data generator
A,B,C,Dfour values to fill

Definition at line 55 of file datasource.h.

int(* obdsim_generator::idle)(void *gen, int idlems)

Called whenever the simulator is idle.

Parameters:
idlemsTake no longer than this many milliseconds
Returns:
anything other than zero is considered a condition which means we must exit
